business.headline: IT, defence or PSU banking? Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

Experts bet big on this financial stock at record high. Should you buy?Experts recommend the financial stock as a strong buy for investors focusing on financial stocks, while also suggesting PSU banks, defence tech firms, and auto ancillary stocks as potential picks.

DreamFolks share price tumble 5% today. Why is it under pressure?DreamFolks shares fell sharply in early trade after the company quit the domestic lounge business, a move that could reshape its position in India's fast-evolving airport services market.

entertainment.headline: Saiyaara becomes Netflix's top non-English film worldwide in debut weekMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' tops Netflix's global non-English film chart in debut week. Exclusive: Has The Bengal Files locked its OTT deal for twice its budget?Director Vivek Agnihotri has sold the streaming rights for his political-thriller 'The Bengal Files' for twice its budget, according to reports. The film is based on Direct Action Day, 1946 and Noakhali riots.

Are Mirai, HanuMan and folklore films creating India's Harry Potter moment?The recent commercial hits from the Telugu film industry like 'Mirai', 'Mahavatar Narsimha', 'HanuMan' and 'Karthikeya 2' are slowly turning ancient texts and folklore into a new cinematic wave. Is their grand success the beginning of a new style of storytelling in Indian cinema? Does this also indicate that India's 'Harry Potter' moment has finally arrived? IndiaToday.in shares insights.

What's next?Tollywood is witnessing a significant shift as Teja Sajja's 'Mirai' breaks the traditional star system with its mythological fantasy and impressive VFX. This success signals a new era for Telugu cinema, where compelling stories rooted in Indian lore are becoming the real crowd-pullers.

In just 293 characters, PM Modi managed to reaffirm Indo-US ties, signal India's balanced stance on Ukraine, and leave trade troubles unsaid.

Khalistanis threaten siege of Indian consulate in Canada over Nijjar killingUS-based Khalistani outfit Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) has announced a siege of the Indian Consulate in Vancouver, Canada, on September 18 over the killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar. Hawai chappal at 25,000 feet: Munna takes hawai jahaj to KolkataAfter Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the airport in Bihar's Purnea, a meme showing a person in hawai chappal on a flight to Kolkata was widely shared on social media. "Hawai chappal waley bhi hawai jahaj mei udega," said Modi in 2016. Beyond the reels and fun, the new airport under the UDAN scheme will boost regional connectivity, opportunities and a potential boom in makhana trade for eastern Bihar and beyond.

The initiative is part of the Prerana experiential learning programme, promoting values, character, and social-emotional learning amongst students nationwide.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
